<a id="InputEventScreenDrag"></a>

# InputEventScreenDrag

**Inherits:** [InputEventFromWindow](InputEventFromWindow.md) **\<** [InputEvent](InputEvent.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Represents a screen drag event.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Stores information about screen drag events. See [Node._input()](Node.md#Node_private_method__input).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Using InputEvent](../tutorials/inputs/inputevent.md)

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="InputEventScreenDrag_property_index"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **index** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventScreenDrag_property_index)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_index**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_index**\ (\ )

The drag event index in the case of a multi-drag event.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEventScreenDrag_property_pen_inverted"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **pen_inverted** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventScreenDrag_property_pen_inverted)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_pen_inverted**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **get_pen_inverted**\ (\ )

Returns ``true`` when using the eraser end of a stylus pen.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEventScreenDrag_property_position"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **position** = `Vector2(0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventScreenDrag_property_position)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_position**\ (\ value\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ )
- [Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_position**\ (\ )

The drag position in the viewport the node is in, using the coordinate system of this viewport.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEventScreenDrag_property_pressure"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **pressure** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventScreenDrag_property_pressure)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_pressure**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_pressure**\ (\ )

Represents the pressure the user puts on the pen. Ranges from ``0.0`` to ``1.0``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEventScreenDrag_property_relative"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **relative** = `Vector2(0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventScreenDrag_property_relative)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_relative**\ (\ value\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ )
- [Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_relative**\ (\ )

The drag position relative to the previous position (position at the last frame).

\ **Note:** [relative](InputEventScreenDrag.md#InputEventScreenDrag_property_relative) is automatically scaled according to the content scale factor, which is defined by the project's stretch mode settings. This means touch sensitivity will appear different depending on resolution when using [relative](InputEventScreenDrag.md#InputEventScreenDrag_property_relative) in a script that handles touch aiming. To avoid this, use [screen_relative](InputEventScreenDrag.md#InputEventScreenDrag_property_screen_relative) instead.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEventScreenDrag_property_screen_relative"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **screen_relative** = `Vector2(0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventScreenDrag_property_screen_relative)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_screen_relative**\ (\ value\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ )
- [Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_screen_relative**\ (\ )

The unscaled drag position relative to the previous position in screen coordinates (position at the last frame). This position is *not* scaled according to the content scale factor or calls to [InputEvent.xformed_by()](InputEvent.md#InputEvent_method_xformed_by). This should be preferred over [relative](InputEventScreenDrag.md#InputEventScreenDrag_property_relative) for touch aiming regardless of the project's stretch mode.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEventScreenDrag_property_screen_velocity"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **screen_velocity** = `Vector2(0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventScreenDrag_property_screen_velocity)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_screen_velocity**\ (\ value\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ )
- [Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_screen_velocity**\ (\ )

The unscaled drag velocity in pixels per second in screen coordinates. This velocity is *not* scaled according to the content scale factor or calls to [InputEvent.xformed_by()](InputEvent.md#InputEvent_method_xformed_by). This should be preferred over [velocity](InputEventScreenDrag.md#InputEventScreenDrag_property_velocity) for touch aiming regardless of the project's stretch mode.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEventScreenDrag_property_tilt"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **tilt** = `Vector2(0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventScreenDrag_property_tilt)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_tilt**\ (\ value\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ )
- [Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_tilt**\ (\ )

Represents the angles of tilt of the pen. Positive X-coordinate value indicates a tilt to the right. Positive Y-coordinate value indicates a tilt toward the user. Ranges from ``-1.0`` to ``1.0`` for both axes.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEventScreenDrag_property_velocity"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **velocity** = `Vector2(0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#InputEventScreenDrag_property_velocity)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_velocity**\ (\ value\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ )
- [Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_velocity**\ (\ )

The drag velocity.

\ **Note:** [velocity](InputEventScreenDrag.md#InputEventScreenDrag_property_velocity) is automatically scaled according to the content scale factor, which is defined by the project's stretch mode settings. This means touch sensitivity will appear different depending on resolution when using [velocity](InputEventScreenDrag.md#InputEventScreenDrag_property_velocity) in a script that handles touch aiming. To avoid this, use [screen_velocity](InputEventScreenDrag.md#InputEventScreenDrag_property_screen_velocity) instead.
